com.Interface.Employee.controllers

Class EmployeeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.Interface.Employee.controllers.EmployeeController

  • @Controller
 @EnableTransactionManagement
public class EmployeeController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains of Mapping controlling methods which get and post HTTP requests for user's view. It is related to 'Employee' component,

    It takes the Submitted url and compare with the given @RequestMapping on the class.

    Author:
    Ahmed A.Moniem Hassan
    See Also:
    EmployeeService, Employee

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmployeeController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addEmployee(Employee employee)
      Handle "/employee/add" requested page, it takes an Employee object and check if it have an id = 0, that means it is a new Employee and be saved as a new record on database, else, it will update the employee with requested emp_id
      java.lang.String editEmployee(int emp_id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handle "/employee/edit/{id}" requested page, it takes an emp_id and gets it's record with the submitted Employee object, and view it on the view to be modified by the user.
      java.lang.String listEmployees(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Handle "/employees" requested page, and added two model attributes to be send to the returned view.
      java.lang.String removeEmployee(int emp_id)
      Handle "/employee/remove/{id}" requested page, it takes an emp_id and remove it record from the database, by calling deleteEmployee from employeeService object.
      void setDepartmentService(DepartmentService departmentService)
      sets the mapped bean implementation class object for DepartmentService interface.
      void setEmployeeService(EmployeeService employeeService)
      sets the mapped bean implementation class object for EmployeeService interface.

      • EmployeeController

        public EmployeeController()

    • Method Detail

      • setEmployeeService

        @Autowired(required=true)
 @Qualifier(value="EmployeeService")
public void setEmployeeService(EmployeeService employeeService)
        sets the mapped bean implementation class object for EmployeeService interface.

      • setDepartmentService

        @Autowired(required=true)
 @Qualifier(value="DepartmentService")
public void setDepartmentService(DepartmentService departmentService)
        sets the mapped bean implementation class object for DepartmentService interface.

      • listEmployees

        @RequestMapping(value="/employees",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String listEmployees(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Handle "/employees" requested page, and added two model attributes to be send to the returned view.
        • employee : sets an empty Employee object, this object will be filled by the user input.
        • ListEmployees : gets list off Employee objects, and send it to the view to be shown on table.
        Parameters:
        org.springframwork.ui.Model - object. sets attributes that to be reflected on the view.
        Returns:
        a string of the requested view name.

      • addEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee/add",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String addEmployee(@ModelAttribute(value="employee")
                                                                                                        Employee employee)
        Handle "/employee/add" requested page, it takes an Employee object and check if it have an id = 0, that means it is a new Employee and be saved as a new record on database, else, it will update the employee with requested emp_id
        Parameters:
        Employee - Object. which will be submitted from the view as model attribute.
        Returns:
        a string for redirecting to listEmployees control method.

      • removeEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee/remove/{id}")
public java.lang.String removeEmployee(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                      int emp_id)
        Handle "/employee/remove/{id}" requested page, it takes an emp_id and remove it record from the database, by calling deleteEmployee from employeeService object.
        Parameters:
        Integer - emp_id. represent the id of the record that should be removed.
        Returns:
        a string for redirecting to listEmployees control method.

      • editEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee/edit/{emp_id}")
public java.lang.String editEmployee(@PathVariable(value="emp_id")
                                                                                      int emp_id,
                                                                                      org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Handle "/employee/edit/{id}" requested page, it takes an emp_id and gets it's record with the submitted Employee object, and view it on the view to be modified by the user. It submit two model attributes for the view :
        • employee : sets an Employee object, which contain the employee data that requested by the submitted emp_id.
        • ListEmployees : gets list off Employee objects, and send it to the view to be shown on table.
        Parameters:
        org.springframwork.ui.Model - object. sets attributes that to be reflected on the view.
        Integer - emp_id. represent the id of the record that should be edited.
        Returns:
        a string of the requested view name.
